body:
I agree with @chancancode.  Also, I think #clean and #deep_clean are terrible names because 'cleaning' can mean anything.  You're removing blanks deeply.  You can always add it as an extension on your own project/s though...

Perhaps I could imagine a set of "deep" enumerable methods all of which applied to nested enumerables as well as top level.  
If you had those, you could write:

  Person.all.map(&:phone_numbers).reject_deeply(&:blank?)

which I think is more expressive than simply #clean.

But even these I think I'd put in a separate gem as I don't think they are commonly enough needed or relevant enough to rails' purpose to go in rails....
